author: Jeremy Freeborn
title: Blue Jackets defenseman Zach Werenski out with a leg injury
text: Columbus Blue Jackets defenseman Zach Werenski of Grosse Pointe, Michigan will be out week-to-week with a lower body injury according to Field Level Media and ESPN on Thursday. The injury is noteworthy because Werenski is considered one of the top players on the Blue Jackets roster. How and when did the injury occur? The injury occurred on Wednesday evening in the Blue Jackets‚Äôs 4-3 overtime loss to the New Jersey Devils. Werenski reportedly got tangled up with New Jersey Devils left winger Ondrej Palat of Frydek-Mistek, Czech Republic, and when Werenski tried to get back up, he could not put any weight on his left leg. In 11 minutes and 15 seconds of ice time against the Devils, Werenski was a +1 with two blocked shots in 11 minutes and 15 seconds of ice time. Blue Jackets leading scorer After 26 games, Werenski has one goal and 24 assists for 25 points. He is a +2 with 10 penalty minutes, five power-play points, 87 shots on goal, 58 blocked shots, seven hits, 13 takeaways and 10 giveaways. Werenski‚Äôs lone goal in 2023-24 was scored on October 20 in a 3-1 Blue Jackets win over the Calgary Flames. Werenski scored an unassisted empty net goal with two minutes and 21 seconds left in the third period. Werenski is one of only two defensemen in the NHL to lead his team in scoring this season. The other is Vince Dunn of Mississauga, Ontario, who has a Seattle Kraken leading 29 points. Blue Jackets near the bottom of the NHL After 36 games, the Columbus Blue Jackets have a record of 11 wins, 18 regulation losses, and seven losses in extra time for 29 points. Only four NHL teams have fewer points than Columbus. The Anaheim Ducks and Ottawa Senators each have 26 points. The Chicago Blackhawks have 23 points, and the San Jose Sharks have 21 points. Columbus also has not made the NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs in four years.

author: El Siglo de Torre√≥n
title: Wall Street cierra mixto y el Dow Jones sube un 0.14 % | El Siglo de Torre√≥n
text: (EL SIGLO DE TORRE√ìN) [EFE](https://www.google.com/search?as_sitesearch=elsiglodetorreon.com.mx&q=EFE) Wall Street cerr√≥ este jueves en terreno mixto y su principal indicador, el Dow Jones de Industriales, subi√≥ un 0,14 %, alcanzando un nuevo m√°ximo al cierre (el s√©ptimo este mes) de 37.710 puntos. Al cierre de las operaciones en la Bolsa de Nueva York, el selectivo S&P 500 creci√≥ un leve 0,04 %, hasta 4.783 unidades, cada vez m√°s cerca de superar su mejor cifra hist√≥rica. El √≠ndice Nasdaq, en el que cotizan las grandes tecnol√≥gicas, baj√≥ un ligero 0,03 %, hasta 15.095 enteros. Con solo un d√≠a de negociaci√≥n restante en 2023, los principales indicadores van camino de cerrar el a√±o con ganancias. "Lo que estamos viendo ahora es que el mercado muestra una resiliencia extrema. Tenemos todas las posibilidades del mundo de que el mercado caiga y se niega a caer de manera significativa. Eso me dice que los alcistas mantienen un claro control", coment√≥ a la cadena CNBC Adam Sarham, director ejecutivo de Park Investments. Por sectores, domin√≥ el verde, con las mayores subidas para el de servicios p√∫blicos (0,7 %) y el de bienes ra√≠ces (0,53 %). Las mayores p√©rdidas fueron para el sector de la energ√≠a (-1,46 %) y el de materiales (-0,46 %). Entre los 30 valores del Dow Jones destacaron las subidas de Nike (1,58 %) y 3M (0,87 %). Mientras, las mayores bajadas fueron para Chevron (-1,37 %) y Dow Inc. (-0,86 %). Por otro lado, el bono del Tesoro estadounidense a diez a√±os, de referencia, subi√≥ hasta el 3,842 %, y los futuros del oro estadounidense bajaron hasta alcanzar los 2.077 d√≥lares la onza. En otros mercados, el petr√≥leo de Texas baj√≥ hasta los 71,77 d√≥lares el barril, y al cierre de la Bolsa, el d√≥lar ganaba terreno frente al euro, con un cambio de 1,1062.

author: Emily Kopp
title: Study Examines 'Post-Vaccination Syndrome' Despite Health Authorities Deeming Topic 'Radioactive'
text:
Persistent levels of spike protein from COVID-19 vaccines could be associated with a range of chronic symptoms like excessive fatigue, brain fog and muscle aches, according to a Yale University study published Wednesday.
The study describes these symptoms and others ‚Äî including tingling and numbness, exercise intolerance and difficulty concentrating ‚Äî as post-vaccine syndrome or PVS. Other symptoms included trouble falling or staying asleep, nerve damage, muscle aches, anxiety, tinnitus and burning sensations. The study was published as a preprint, meaning it has not yet found a home in a scientific journal and has yet to be vetted by outside scientists via peer review.
The researchers studied 42 individuals they diagnosed with PVS. The researchers tested for dozens of potential biological signatures of the syndrome using serology, or blood tests, uncovering a range of hypotheses about the underlying causes.
The researchers hesitated to pinpoint any one single cause, emphasizing that further studies are needed.
But perhaps the most striking clue the researchers picked up was significantly higher circulating levels of spike protein as compared to the control group. Individuals vaccinated 600 to 700 days prior had more elevated levels of spike protein than other participants who had been vaccinated more recently.
However the study only measured each individual‚Äôs spike protein levels once, thus could not determine whether the spike protein was increasing over time.
‚Äú This suggested that prolonged antigen persistence might be associated with PVS in a subgroup of patients,‚Äù the study reads.
Our preprint on post-vaccination syndrome is out. We studied immune signatures and examined spike protein in the blood of people who have developed chronic illnesses after COVID-19 vaccination. (1/) https://t.co/Mc5DfHYRyF
‚Äî Prof. Akiko Iwasaki (@VirusesImmunity) February 20, 2025
The study included participants who had received the Pfizer, Moderna and Johnson & Johnson shots.
Another potential signal of the syndrome explored in the paper is T cell exhaustion ‚Äî when white blood cells progressively lose the ability to fight off infections. People with PVS also had fewer antibodies against the spike protein as compared to the control group. It‚Äôs also possible that the syndrome is associated with a reactivation of dormant Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), a common and usually latent virus.
The researchers acknowledged that PVS has been neglected by health authorities, as many consider the topic ‚Äúradioactive.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis is a hard topic to study. People don‚Äôt want to fund it and journals don‚Äôt want to publish it because it is viewed as radioactive and I‚Äôm so grateful to my co-authors for staying the course,‚Äù said David Putrino, director of Rehabilitation Innovation for the Mount Sinai Health System and a coauthor of the paper, in an X thread . ‚ÄúTo anyone saying that this paper will embolden antivax movements, please take a moment to consider an alternate take: failing to be transparent in the moment, denying the lived experience of many and hiding the truth is what emboldens anti-science movements. In the history of drug discovery, there has never been a drug that didn‚Äôt produce side effects in a percentage of users. Pretending this fact isn‚Äôt real is dishonest.‚Äù
anti-science movements. In the history of drug discovery, there has never been a drug that DIDN‚ÄôT produce side effects in a percentage of users. Pretending this fact isn‚Äôt real is dishonest. Attempting to hide, deny or shame people with PVS because their existence is 15/
‚Äî Putrino Lab (@PutrinoLab) February 19, 2025
Yet some in the scientific community criticized the scientists for publishing the preprint at all.
The study drew data from the Yale School of Medicine‚Äôs Listen to Immune, Symptom and Treatment Experiences Now (LISTEN) study, as well as the Centre for Post COVID Care at Mount Sinai Hospital.
The PVS group had poorer health and a poorer quality of life than average, despite the cohort having no preexisting comorbidities and being relatively young (median age 43).
Long COVID shares many of the same symptoms of PVS, the researchers wrote, though there are some differences. While long COVID can be associated with elevated SARS-CoV-2 antibodies, the individuals with PVS in the new study had lower antibodies than the control group.
The preprint states that the condition afflicts a small fraction of people receiving COVID-19 vaccines. The researchers were quick to emphasize that the COVID-19 vaccines saved lives.
‚ÄúBy revealing distinct immunological features of PVS, this study helped generate hypotheses regarding the underlying pathobiology of this condition,‚Äù the study reads. ‚ÄúUnderstanding such mechanisms will help improve the overall safety profile of COVID-19 vaccines and support public health strategies that maximize vaccine efficacy while minimizing adverse effects.‚Äù
The study arrives amid Robert F. Kennedy Jr.‚Äôs first days at the helm of the Department of Health and Human Services.
His ascension to the role of HHS secretary could prompt a second look at policies promulgated by the Biden administration around the COVID-19 vaccine, including the decision to mandate vaccination of some individuals with a previous COVID-19 infection as a precondition for employment.

author: Laurine Maurice
title: El cielo de Alicante se ilumina con una sorprendente aurora boreal de color rosa
text:
Por segunda vez este a√±o , el cielo de Alicante se ha iluminado de una particular forma muy poco com√∫n en esta zona del planeta.
As√≠ lo ha anunciado a trav√©s de X y de una fotograf√≠a de Ricardo Pag√°n, el Laboratorio de Climatolog√≠a de la Universidad de Alicante.
Durante la noche del pasado 10 de octubre , una aurora boreal de color rosa se ha dejado ver en los alrededores de Villena.
La √∫ltima vez que ocurri√≥ este fen√≥meno metrol√≥gico fue el pasado 11 de mayo de 2024 , cuando una aurora boreal se dejaba ver en el cielo de la Comunitat Valenciana, pudiendo ser contemplada desde las localidades de Xert, Forcall, Benic√†ssim, Camporrobles, Valencia, Ontinyent, Pedreguer, Altea y Villena.
Eloy Proyecto Maestral
[La tormenta solar llega a Alicante e ilumina el cielo con auroras boreales] Una aurora boreal es un fen√≥meno natural que ocurre cuando part√≠culas cargadas del viento solar interact√∫an con el campo magn√©tico de la Tierra.
Este proceso ocurre principalmente en las r egiones polares del hemisferio norte, y el fen√≥meno en el hemisferio sur se conoce como aurora austral.
Por segunda vez este a√±o, hemos podido contemplar una aurora boreal en nuestros cielos.
As√≠ se vio anoche desde los alrededores de #Villena .
üì∏ Ricardo Pag√°n. pic.twitter.com/AsGCa620Eh

author: El Nuevo Diario
title: Candidata a regidora del D.N. env√≠a mensaje de aliento al pueblo dominicano
text:
EL NUEVO DIARIO, SANTO DOMINGO.- La candidata a regidora de la circunscripci√≥n #1 del Distrito Nacional por el partido Patria Libre, Vian Santana, transmiti√≥ un mensaje a la poblaci√≥n asegurando que el pa√≠s tiene un futuro brillante, debido a una sociedad emergente de individuos preocupados que han reconocido que la antigua pol√≠tica ya no es funcional.
‚ÄúNosotros creemos firmemente en que como nueva derecha nos estamos levantando y somos la voz de personas que consideran que no tienen una representaci√≥n. Estamos en pie de lucha y vamos a dar el todo por el todo para llevar adelante nuestro pa√≠s y en especial al Distrito Nacional, a la posici√≥n que nos merecemos, que es la victoria‚Äù, expres√≥ la aspirante a regidora.
Santa emiti√≥ este mensaje al ser entrevistada por el comunicador Miguel Alm√°nzar, en el programa ‚ÄúAqu√≠ Hablamos Claro‚Äù, transmitido por la plataforma digital de El Nuevo Diario TV.
(Ver programa).
Adem√°s, la candidata expres√≥ que en el Distrito Nacional hay muchas deficiencias todav√≠a, problemas que no se han podido solucionar, sin embargo, han realizado unos estudios para su plan de gobierno municipal.
Sostuvo que para avanzar como Distrito y sociedad atender√° las principales problem√°ticas que son puntos neur√°lgicos, como es el tema del tr√°nsito, ya que las soluciones que se han implementado no han dado resultado.
En temas como el de seguridad, plante√≥ la necesidad de iluminar la ciudad para que se pueda transitar a cualquier hora, sin sentir amenaza cuando pase un motorizado porque no pueda ver lo que viene en direcci√≥n debido a la poca iluminaci√≥n.

author: Ethan James
title: Sydney to Hobart: Alive primed to claim Sydney to Hobart overall win
text:
Tasmanian yacht Alive is in the box seat to take out Sydney to Hobart overall honours, with skipper Duncan Hine confident the 66-footer has a winning time on the board.
Hine and his crew finished the 628-nautical-mile blue water classic on Thursday afternoon as clubhouse leaders on handicap time.
Alive was one of just six yachts to have crossed the River Derwent finish line by Thursday night, with more than 80 still at sea.
Alive is no stranger to success, having claimed the overall win in 2018 and fourth spot in 2019.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a waiting game,‚Äù Hine said.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre looking good though. I believe we could do it again, but the reality may be different.
Advertisement ‚ÄúNow we wait with bated breath to see if anyone can beat our time.‚Äù
Alive was one of just six yachts to have crossed the River Derwent finish line by Thursday night, with more than 80 still at sea.
Its biggest threat appears to be another Tasmanian yacht, Kraken 111 - the two-handed entrant must finish by 7.09pm on Friday to top Alive‚Äôs mark.
The overall winner, which is awarded the Tattersall Cup, is judged on handicap, which takes into account factors including the size of the boat.
Supermaxi LawConnect claimed the first-past-the-post line honours on Thursday morning in the second-closest finish in Sydney to Hobart history.
LawConnect came from behind to beat fellow 100-footer and 2022 winner Andoo Comanche by just 51 seconds.
Advertisement Skipper and owner Christian Beck, who won line honours for the first time, said it was a dream finish aided by a breeze at the right moment.
Comanche had the lead heading into the River Derwent, but LawConnect proved better in light winds.
There was added drama when a spectator boat passed close to Comanche near the finish line.
Police subsequently said action would be taken against a 57-year-old male skipper of a private vessel for allegedly encroaching into an exclusion zone against safety regulations.
Comanche skipper John Winning Jr told the ABC the incident didn‚Äôt cost his yacht the race.
‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way, I wish there were 500 of them [spectators],‚Äù he said.
Advertisement ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs even, everyone gets the same thing. If they were ahead of us, they would have had the wash, but unfortunately, we got the wash.‚Äù
Fourteen of the starting fleet of 103 have retired, including supermaxi SHK Scallywag.
AAP
